Hello,

here are a few comments on the topic:

  1.  As far as I understand, a smartphone must be recognized as a smartphone. Otherwise, the four device types listed under "List of Device Types" would be superfluous. [cid:image001.png@01DB9A5A.24C27720]
Why a smartphone is recognized as a USB modem is unclear here.
Shouldn't it be enough to recognize the smartphone only as one device, namely as a smartphone?

  2.  Furthermore, the smartphone is recognized as a "Windows Portable Device (Media Transfer Protocol)" device type. If MTP is used to exchange data between the computer and the smartphone, why isn't the smartphone recognized as an "Android Smartphone (Media Transfer Protocol)" device type?
Hint:
Description of a “Windows Portable Device (Media Transfer Protocol)”:
USB connected devices that use the MTP protocol to transfer data such as Android devices, digital cameras, etc.
It seems as if this device type makes the “Android Smartphone” device type superfluous.

  3.  Why is the Samsung Smartphone also recognized as a Teensy Board?
Description of a Teensy Board:
Devices like the USB-based Microcontroller Development System

  4.  If the log report is filtered for a Galaxy S23, there are no results for a smartphone connected via USB.
[cid:image002.png@01DB9A5F.810BDAD0]

What is your opinion of the comments listed?
